system_prompt: You are a clinical pharmacist producing structured medication analysis. Return ONLY valid JSON.
user_prompt:
Analyze the medication below and return a comprehensive structured report.

Medication: parcetamol
Indication: N/A
Other medications: None
Web research context:
[1] Paracetamol - uses, side effects and how to take it (www.healthdirect.gov.au) - # Paracetamol. ## What is paracetamol? Paracetamol is a medicine used to reduce pain. ## What is paracetamol used for? Paracetamol can be used for:. ## How do I take paracetamol? ## Can I take paracetamol with my other medicines? Do not take paracetamol if you are also taking other medicines that contain paracetamol. * check with your doctor or pharmacist that you can take your medicine with paracetamol. ## When should I not take paracetamol? Do not take paracetamol if you have:. * taken other medicines that contain paracetamol. As with any medicine taken during pregnancy, you should get medical advice before taking paracetamol. * You can also see healthdirect's list of medicines that contain paracetamol. Ibuprofen & paracetamol are two of the most commonly used over-the-counter (OTC) medicines to treat pain & fever in children. *Read more on NPS MedicineWise website* ### Kids Health Info : Pain-relief medicine for children - paracetamol and ibuprofen. https://www.healthdirect.gov.au/paracetamol
[2] Paracetamol (en.wikipedia.org) - Regulatory agencies, including the European Medicines Agency (EMA), the Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agency (MHRA), the World Health Organization (WHO), and the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) recommend paracetamol as a first-line analgesic and antipyretic in pregnancy, with use limited to situations where necessary, at the lowest effective dose, and for the shortest duration. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paracetamol
[3] Paracetamol Uses, Dosage, Side Effects, Warnings (www.drugs.com) - # Paracetamol. ## What is paracetamol? ## What is paracetamol used for? ## Who should not take paracetamol? ## How should I take paracetamol? ### Paracetamol 500mg tablets and capsules. #### Paracetamol 500 mg tablets and capsules dosing- Adults and children 10 years of age and older. #### Paracetamol 120 mg/5 ml oral suspension dosing - Children from 3 months to 6 years. #### Paracetamol 250 mg/5 ml oral suspension dosing - Adults and children 6 years of age and older. #### Paracetamol suppository dosing - Children from 3 months to 12 years. #### Paracetamol 250 mg orally disintegrating tablets - Adults and children 6 years of age and older. #### Paracetamol 500 mg effervescent tablets - children 12 years and over and adults. Acetaminophen and paracetamol are the generic names of medicines used to treat mild pain, headache and fever. There are no differences in the chemical or therapeutics uses of acetaminophen and paracetamol, although recommended doses or available products may differ between countries. https://www.drugs.com/paracetamol.html
[4] Paracetamol for adults: painkiller for pain and high ... (www.nhs.uk) - # Paracetamol for adults - Brand names: Disprol, Hedex, Medinol, Panadol. Find out how paracetamol for adults treats aches, pains and high temperature, and how to take it. * Taking it with other medicines and herbal supplements. ## Related conditions. ## Related resources. * 10 ways to reduce pain. https://www.nhs.uk/medicines/paracetamol-for-adults/
[5] Paracetamol (www.nhsinform.scot) - Paracetamol is safe for most people to take and side effects are rare. You can buy most types of paracetamol from supermarkets or pharmacies. ## What is paracetamol used for? Paracetamol can be used to treat pain, including:. ## Types of paracetamol. ## How to take paracetamol. How much paracetamol you can take depends on:. * the type of paracetamol you’re taking. * how strong the paracetamol is. Side effects from paracetamol are rare but can include:. Speak to a pharmacist or doctor if you develop any worrying side effects that you think could be caused by paracetamol. Always get advice before taking paracetamol if you:. ### Other medicines and paracetamol. Check the leaflet that comes with your medicine to see if it can be taken with paracetamol. ## Paracetamol overdose. After taking too much paracetamol, some people:. You should speak to a pharmacist or GP practice if you have taken more than the recommended dose of paracetamol and are feeling unwell. https://www.nhsinform.scot/tests-and-treatments/medicines-and-medical-aids/types-of-medicine/paracetamol/
